participant_1.name: Emily Johnson
participant_1.personality: Empathetic and supportive, Emily is always ready to encourage others, having experienced the challenges of moving frequently and making new friends.
participant_1.background: I chew my nails. I was a navy brat and have attended 16 schools in 12 years. I am studying to be a special education teacher. I make friends fast and say goodbye fast. I kayak at the lake on weekends.

participant_2.name: Michael Smith
participant_2.personality: Shy yet passionate, Michael grapples with his self-confidence but strives to express himself through music.
participant_2.background: Until recently I have never been able to sing in front of anyone. Anyways I decided to give it a try and participated in an audition for a talent show. I was accepted to participate. I am a shy person but I love to sing. My shyness made me panic and I did not show up.

content.text: I'm so sorry to hear that you didn't show up for the talent show. I know how it feels to be shy, and I can understand why you might have panicked. But I also think it's important to push yourself outside of your comfort zone sometimes.
Thank you. It was a hard decision, but I'm glad I did it. It's helped me to realize that I can do more than I thought.
That's great to hear! I'm glad you're feeling more confident.
Me too! I'm still working on my shyness, but I'm making progress.
I'm sure you'll get there. Just keep taking small steps.
Thanks for the encouragement.
No problem! So, what else do you like to do for fun?
I like to go kayaking at the lake on weekends. It's a great way to relax and enjoy the outdoors.
That sounds fun! I've never been kayaking before.
You should try it! It's a lot of fun.
I might just have to do that.
You won't regret it!
I'm sure I won't.
So, what do you do for a living?
I'm a special education teacher.
Oh, that's great! I'm sure you're a great teacher.
Thanks! I try my best.
So, what do you like most about being a teacher?
I love helping kids learn and grow. It's so rewarding to see them succeed.
That's so great! I'm sure you're a great teacher.
Thanks! I try my best.
